_header: Gracious Lord for Thy bitter passion
_description: A prayer by the Five Wounds — fifty-four lines in quatrains and couplets

BodDou1.First Lines:
Gracious lorde for thy bitter passionAccepte my prayers that I do
                    repete…
BodDou1.Last Lines:
…Graciously be my refuge and boteAnd conforte in
                    aduersyte
BodDou1.Attributed Title: Of the v woundes of our lorde (f. 71)
BodDou1.Editions:
Gray,  Douglas. 
             “The Five Wounds of Our Lord.” 
             Notes and Queries
         n.s. 10 [208] (1963): 50-51, 82-89, 127-34, 163-8: 50-1.
